title: Ticket #1283: Windows script check when creating a process
description: Check the return code on creating a process and if the file exists but marked as not executable check for #!, then check registry for the correct interpreter, and execute.

I'm slowly not liking this idea over time:

  1. It's just not the way it's done in windows.
  2. Nothing prohibits them from trying to call <interpreter> file from their submission
  3. Nothing prohibits them from providing an .ext which allows win to call the appropriate interpreter.
